RainbruRPG::Core::Tokenizer

RainbruRPG::Core::Tokenizer Class Reference

#include <tokenizer.h>

Collaboration diagram for RainbruRPG::Core::Tokenizer:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Used to tokenize the console's commands.

The separators can be :

  • a space;
  • a point. The [ ] pair.

To use it, create an instance of this class and call setText(char *) with the string you want to tokenize. The result will be in the tTokentizerReturn structure.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RainbruRPG::Core::Tokenizer::Tokenizer (  ) 

The default constructor.

It set the token variable to 0 and the TokenizerRet to "".

The default destructor.

Actually, it makes nothing.

Member Function Documentation

void RainbruRPG::Core::Tokenizer::clear (  ) 

Clear the tTokentizerReturn returned object.

This method must be call between each setText call

std::string  sep 
) [private]

Get the position of a separator in a string.

If sep isn't found, returns string::npos.

Parameters:

Returns:

std::string RainbruRPG::Core::Tokenizer::nextToken ( std::string &  s  )  [private]

Get the next token in this string.

This method Search for the next separator, return the found token and erase it in the original string.

Parameters:
s The string to search in
Returns:
The token we found or an empty string

void RainbruRPG::Core::Tokenizer::setCmdType (  )  [private]

Set the command type according to the number of tokens not empty.

This method check the ret global function to know how many tokens have been found.

RainbruRPG::Core::tTokentizerReturn RainbruRPG::Core::Tokenizer::setText ( char *  c  ) 

Set the Tokenizer to work with this string.

First, we call the trim function in a std::string representing c and we check if it is empty. If it is not empty, we call 5 times the nextToken function and finally set the command type by calling setCmdType().

Parameters:
c The char* string to tokenize
Returns:
The result of the tokenizer stored in a tTokentizerReturn structure.

std::string RainbruRPG::Core::Tokenizer::specialToken ( std::string &  s,
std::string  c 
) [private]

Return the token delimited by c.

This function is used to found a token d√©limited by [/] or '/'.

First, we erase the first letter of s because it is the opened delimiter ([ or '). Then we search the position of c in the resulting string. If c is not found, we have an error, otherwise we can substring the token we found and erase the closed separator to the string we return.

Parameters:
s The tring to search in
c The separator we want to search in s
Returns:
The token we found or "" if an error occured
